name: aboriginal
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a member of a race of people who were the first people to live in a country, before any colonists arrived: The river was once a trade route for aboriginals and fur traders who built communities along its bank. What does it mean to be an Native American or indigenous aboriginal today? See also
Aborigine
More examplesFewer examplesCathy Freeman, an aboriginal, was given the honour of lighting the Olympic flame. It was one of the first books published by an Australian aboriginal.The land is owned by the Aboriginals that live there.
consisting of or relating to a race of people who lived in a country before any colonists arrived: The Arunta are an aboriginal tribe from central Australia. North American Aboriginal peoples have differing views concerning burial excavation. Aboriginal art/traditions See also
Aborigine
More examplesFewer examplesShe is a passionate supporter of the Aboriginal community.For thousands of years, its aboriginal inhabitants lived in organized social groupings.Aboriginal spirituality has a strong ethical component.
Add to word list
Add to word list
having lived or existed in a place since the earliest known time: The exhibit was of aboriginal plants of this area.
